ygData.subject: RE: Question about experience penalty (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I see.  I can t really say much on this - I haven t lost many levels.  The only other time I lost a level was L27- L26.  I didn t notice any unusual exp
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 3 Jan 2000, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:

> I think that was part of the point I was trying to make. That it was
> difficult to tell if the level 31 drop was really bigger than the level 30
> drop since the level 30 bubbles are so much bigger than the level 31 ones.
> Since I saw a bigger drop across levels on non-hell levels (or are they
> mini-hell levels?) I wondered if it wasn't really a double dipping situation
> rather than a loss that was significantly greater one level up.

I see. I can't really say much on this - I haven't lost many
levels. The only other time I lost a level was L27->L26. I
didn't notice any unusual exp loss then. I lost L31 three
times (payback for getting through 30 levels having only lost
my level once I guess). The first time was the worst,
happening immediately after I leveled. The other times
happened further into 31. All of them involved about the same
amount of exp loss (portion_of_L31_bubble/1.0 +
portion_of_L31_bubble/0.5 = constant).

Still, double-dipping or extra-large exp loss, the point is
the same - definitely avoid dying at hell levels + 1, possibly
try to avoid dying at points where you'll lose a level.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
